page.title: 09Shopping in Epworth.
page.content: Epworth is lucky to have a variety of shops ranging from supermarkets to those selling clothes and horse riding equipment. This is a surprising range considering the population is only around 3,000 people. The new Woods' and the planned Leos supermarket do present some smaller shopkeepers with big problems. Some may be forced to close because of the competitive prices. Epworth does lack a good shoe shop. There was one but the shop sells fabrics now. A delicatessen in the village also closed recently as the service seemed to be too specialized for a small community. The overall picture is not one of problems and closures. The centre continues to thrive as it caters for shoppers from surrounding villages who haven't such a good choice of shops.
